parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF code: "11240014".  This strongly suggests an association with electoral campaigning, as CMF codes are mandatory for financial reporting in political campaigns in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions Marian Dumitru, who is identified as the President of the AUR Calarasi County Organization.  While the post doesn't explicitly endorse a vote for him, the strong association with a specific candidate participating in the parliamentary elections is evident. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  The stated aim is to discuss an issue with "hundreds of people" in Calarasi County, indicating an intention to reach a wide audience. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post advocates for online broadcasts of local council meetings. While seemingly a non-partisan issue, the context of the post, linked to a candidate from AUR, suggests an electoral objective.  Improving transparency could indirectly benefit the candidate's image and increase voter support.  The overall aim is to present the candidate in a positive light, implicitly influencing voters' perception. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not adhere to journalistic standards. It lacks objectivity and presents a one-sided perspective on the need for online broadcasts, framing it as a solution easily achievable with minimal cost.  It's presented as a campaign promise rather than an objective news report.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message promoting a specific policy proposal by a candidate, clearly intended to influence voters' perception of his competence and commitment.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>9515737678442617</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly calling for votes, strongly promotes a candidate (Marian Dumitru) and his party (AUR) through a policy proposal presented in a way that implicitly enhances his image. The presence of a CMF code confirms its connection to an electoral campaign. The paid Facebook advertisement targets a wide audience in Calarasi County.  The post's content, while seemingly about transparency, serves an electoral objective by positively framing the candidate.  It does not meet the criteria of journalistic reporting.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Marian Dumitru</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>AUR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Societatea Calarasi Hexel Press SRL, pentru incalcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, dupa ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postari pe Facebook (ID 9515737678442617) cu continut electoral, care promoveaza indirect candidatul Marian Dumitru de la AUR prin prezentarea unei propuneri de politica publica,  avand ca efect electoral cresterea popularitatii si a imaginii sale pozitive in randul alegatorilor din judetul Calarasi. Prezenta codului CMF 11240014 confirma legatura directa cu campania electorala.  Postarea, desi aparent neutrala, serveste unui obiectiv electoral, nefiind o informare jurnalistica obiectiva.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
